award_title: AI-ENGAGE: Image-based phenotyping and multi-omic prediction schemes for horticultural crop improvement
subject: Imaging pipelines for crop phenotyping—what happens after the paper?
body:
Hi Gregory,

I've been thinking about image segmentation models for measuring fruit traits—seems like the kind of method other breeding programs would want to use, but reimplementing from a paper is a pain.

I'm building Ouro to turn published computational methods into callable tools that people can actually reuse without starting from scratch. Keeps seeing the same pattern: good methods that never leave the lab that made them.

Would you be up for a quick chat about this in January?

Hope you have a great holiday.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
